subject: Creativity
title: Writer's Block: The Myth and the Science
description: A 60-second lesson on Writer's Block: The Myth and the Science.

hook.text: Writer's block isn't a disease. It's usually perfectionism, fear, or wrong timing. Knowing which one changes the cure.

buildup.text: Perfectionism says: 'This sentence isn't good enough.' Fear says: 'People will judge me.

discovery.text: For perfectionism: write badly on purpose. Give yourself permission to produce garbage ‚Äî editing fixes garbage; blank.

twist.text: Many famous writers denied writer's block exists. Anthony Trollope: 'A cobbler doesn't wait for inspiration to make.

climax.text: The real fix for most blocks: lower the stakes. Write something tiny. A sentence. A fragment. Motion creates momentum.

punchline.text: Writer's block is real. But its cure is almost always: write anyway.
